examples: it has the ring of sincerity
a ring of ships in the harbor
a halo of smoke

definitions.text: a rigid circular band of metal or wood or other material used for holding or fastening or hanging or pulling
examples: there was still a rusty iron hoop for tying a horse

definitions.text: (chemistry) a chain of atoms in a molecule that forms a closed loop

examples: police tried to break up the gang
a pack of thieves

definitions.text: the sound of a bell ringing; ; ; --E. A. Poe
examples: the distinctive ring of the church bell
the ringing of the telephone
the tintinnabulation that so voluminously swells from the ringing and the dinging of the bells

definitions.text: a platform usually marked off by ropes in which contestants box or wrestle
jewelry consisting of a circlet of precious metal (often set with jewels) worn on the finger
examples: she had rings on every finger
he noted that she wore a wedding band

definitions.text: a strip of material attached to the leg of a bird to identify it (as in studies of bird migration)

examples: the bells rang
the hall resounded with laughter

definitions.text: make (bells) ring, often for the purposes of musical edification
examples: Ring the bells
My uncle rings every Sunday at the local church

definitions.text: get or try to get into communication (with someone) by telephone
examples: I tried to call you all night
Take two aspirin and call me in the morning

definitions.text: extend on all sides of simultaneously; encircle
examples: The forest surrounds my property

definitions.text: attach a ring to the foot of, in order to identify
examples: ring birds
band the geese to observe their migratory patterns
